p: The staff providing childbirth care must be informed about a suspected or confirmed diagnosis of COVID-19 to prepare for and implement biosafety measures, as well as to grant priority for these deliveries to occur in labor, childbirth and postpartum rooms reserved for those with a suspected or confirmed diagnosis of the SARS-CoV-2 infection ( 26, 28- 29) . At the time of delivery, a minimum team of essential workers should be considered; hygiene measures and protective equipment guidelines should be rigorously observed; parturient women should wear surgical or N95 masks; and only one companion should be recommended during labor, childbirth and postpartum ( 23, 26, 29, 34- 45, 48) . This companion should be someone who lives with the mother, does not belong to a risk group, does not present any signs and symptoms of the flu; and wears a mask during his/her entire permanence in the service ( 45) .
